name: Asian Art Museum
description: The Asian Art Museum of San Francisco houses one of the world's most comprehensive collections of Asian art, spanning 6,000 years of history with over 18,000 artworks from across the Asian continent.
fullDescription: The Asian Art Museum of San Francisco houses one of the world's most comprehensive collections of Asian art, spanning 6,000 years of history with over 18,000 artworks from across the Asian continent.
whatTheyOffer:
- Free admission: First Sundays each month for everyone
- Museums for All: $1 admission for EBT cardholders + guests
- Seniors (65+): $12 admission (regularly $20)
- Students with ID: $12 admission
- Military/Veterans: Free admission with valid ID
- Children under 6: Always free
- SF residents: Free admission on select Thursdays
howToGetIt: Visit the museum and present your EBT card, student ID, military ID, or proof of age at the admissions desk. Check the website for free day schedules and any advance reservation requirements.
keywords: Asian Art Museum, San Francisco, Civic Center, free first Sunday, EBT $1, Museums for All, senior discount, student discount, military free, Asia art
